alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:34PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 634 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles south of Lamar, or 21 miles northeast of Wray, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Alvin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
